wikipedia_page.main:
Sophia Julia Woolf (1831–20 November 1893) was an English composer known for songs and opera.
Woolf's father was John Woolf, a furrier.  She had two sisters and was married to John Isaacson. Woolf's daughter, Maud, was the mother of the musician Vivian Ellis

link_mentions.page: List of women composers by birth date

response: Ellis was born in Hampstead, London in 1903 and educated at Cheltenham College. His date of birth is frequently given as 1904 but the Births, Marriages and Deaths Index gives 1903 as the year of registration. He began a musical career as a concert pianist, but became a composer and lyricist. His grandmother, Julia Woolf, had also been a concert pianist as well as composing an opera, Carina.
He also "created" the role of Bobadillo in Julia Woolf's Carina at the London Opera Comique in 1888.
